channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA

item.title: Report E-2024020114
item.description:
Report E-2024020114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Patriot Environmental Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft- by-1ft area of the trailer floor and a 1ft-by-1ft area of the concrete parking lot and estimated that two (2) pounds of material was released due to load shift that damaged one (1) plastic bag. Patriot Environmental Services personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted areas and recovered the spent material. The impacted areas were then treated with a neutralizer. The spent material that was recovered was containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum and the damaged 50-pound plastic bag along with the remaining product was placed into one (1) additional 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite until the waste profile has been completed and approved for transport for disposal.

DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LIGHTLY CRUSHED ON TOP WITH SMALL CRACK AT SEAMLINE BELOW THE MOUTH. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024010760
item.description:
Report X-2024010760

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found by a package handler leaking, so he stopped the belt and let a QA member know. QA moved the package into a hazmat tote to be inspected and processed. The leaking was contained to the box and no absorbent was required. Upon inspection two of the six acetone containers were dented and leaking. DescribePack: The package itself had no rips or tears. The containers inside were dented, causing the leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking was contained to the inside of the package and only mishandling had the items leaking more. No absorbent was needed to mitigate the release only careful handling.

DescribePack: TWO BOTTLES LEAKED A TENTH OF A GALLON INCLUSIVELY AND LEAKED THROUGH THE PLASTIC BAGS. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOAD SIDE WET AND RIPPED/TORN SLIGHTLY. CONTENTS SPRAY NOZZLE BROKE DUE TO AN IMPACT AND LACK OF INNER AND OUTER PACKAGING. CONTENTS ARE AEROSOL CANS BUT PACKAGING HAS NO MARKINGS. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: CONTENTS SPRAY NOZZLE BROKE DUE TO AN IMPACT AND LACK OF INNER AND OUTER PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2024010436
item.description:
Report X-2024010436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FRA Hazmat Inspector Wolfe reported the TILX 306907 releasing an unknown amount of vapor. UP Hazmat responded to the car. Upon inspecting the car, the valve handles were able to be turned very slightly indicating they were in an open position. The valve plugs were impacted with several layers of old teflon tape and thread dope which prohibited the plugs from being fully engaged and secured. There was also old teflon debris inside of the valve body and threaded faceplate. The handles were all closed, and the plugs were removed and cleaned. The debris was also removed from the valve body. New teflon tape was applied to the threads and the plugs were secured tool tight.

item.title: Report X-2024020035
item.description:
Report X-2024020035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: LATHROP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO UNLOAD DOOR UPON ARRIVING RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE. UPON INSPECTING THE PACKAGE RESPONDER NOTICED A SMALL HOLE IN THE CORNER WHICH LED TO SOME OF THE ITEMS FALLING OUT BACK ONTO THE TOTE. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE TOTE, PLACED IT ON A PITO CART SAFE AND SECURED AFTER DOUBLE CHECKING TO SEE IF THEY LEFT ANYTHING BEHIND, RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO HEAD BACK TO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND DISCUSS FURTHER ACTIONS WITH RMP

item.title: Report X-2024010733
item.description:
Report X-2024010733

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was been unloaded when it was realized that it was wet, an admin got called to retrieve the package around 5:00 AM, there was no other damage packages from the leak or any injuries.. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was found that 1 of the gallons had a loss cap as well as the seal had been opened leading to the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Admin was quickly called for an inspection and retrieve the package with adequate equipment to put in an isolated area.

item.title: Report X-2024010732
item.description:
Report X-2024010732

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment external packaging was dented on the two corners on its underside and emitted a strong sweetish chemical odor. It was subsequently removed from the sort stream and put into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: The dents were at the lower part of the cans , the accordioning indicative of compressive force applied from top down on the cans inside the external box .The liquid seeped from the body and underside edges of the can into the inner packaging surrounding it . DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The shipment was taken from the damage discovery site and put into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing. The excess liquid from the spill had been trapped by the plastic bags inside the outer box.
